named_with_benefit.description: Company is explicitly named (non-generic) and a strategic benefit is provided.

variants.template: aligned with {company}'s strategic goal to {benefit}
variants.notes: Standard enterprise wording; neutral and cross-industry.

variants.template: in support of {company}'s priority to {benefit}
variants.notes: Emphasises support, suitable for transformation or change programmes.

variants.template: contributing to {company}'s ambition to {benefit}
variants.notes: Softer, ambition-focused framing; good for long-term programmes.

variants.template: enabling {company} to better {benefit}
variants.notes: Outcome-focused, useful when benefit is clearly action-verb based.

variants.template: strengthening {company}'s ability to {benefit}
variants.notes: Good for capability-building initiatives (platforms, tooling, ways of working).

named_no_benefit.description: Company is explicitly named (non-generic) but no strategic benefit text is provided.

variants.template: aligned with {company}'s strategic priorities
variants.notes: Default when only the company name is known.

variants.template: in support of {company}'s digital and business objectives
variants.notes: Safe wording for most digital, product, or service initiatives.

variants.template: contributing to {company}'s long-term growth agenda
variants.notes: Useful when initiatives are clearly growth-oriented but no detail is provided.

variants.template: supporting {company}'s overall strategic roadmap
variants.notes: Generic but enterprise-sounding; avoids guessing concrete benefits.

generic_with_benefit.description: No specific company name, but a strategic benefit is provided. Uses generic labels like “the organization”.

variants.template: aligned with the organization's strategic goal to {benefit}
variants.notes: Primary generic pattern for benefit-driven objectives.

variants.template: in support of the company's ambition to {benefit}
variants.notes: Balanced between generic “company” wording and outcome focus.

variants.template: contributing to the business objective to {benefit}
variants.notes: Good when benefit text already sounds like a business objective.

variants.template: helping the organization to better {benefit}
variants.notes: Softer, outcome-oriented framing, useful for customer experience work.

variants.template: strengthening the organization's ability to {benefit}
variants.notes: Capability-building focus without naming the company.

generic_no_benefit.description: No specific company name and no benefit text. Purely generic strategic alignment tails.

variants.template: aligned with the organization's strategic priorities
variants.notes: Default generic tail when no benefit is provided.

variants.template: in support of the organization's digital and business objectives
variants.notes: Safe phrase for any digital or transformation initiative.

variants.template: contributing to the company's long-term growth agenda
variants.notes: Long-horizon framing when details are limited.

variants.template: supporting the business roadmap and portfolio goals
variants.notes: Neutral wording that fits portfolio and roadmap contexts.

named_generic_company.description: Company text looks generic or placeholder (e.g., “ACME”, “Company ABC”) and a benefit is present. Treat name as optional flavour.

variants.template: aligned with the organization's strategic goal to {benefit}
variants.notes: Ignores the generic label and focuses on benefit.

variants.template: supporting the company's ambition to {benefit}
variants.notes: Keeps “company” wording but does not lean on the fake name.

variants.template: contributing to the business objective to {benefit}
variants.notes: Suitable when benefit is clear and structured as an objective.

named_generic_no_benefit.description: Company text looks generic or placeholder and no benefit is provided.

variants.template: aligned with the organization's strategic priorities
variants.notes: Completely generic; hides the placeholder company name.

variants.template: supporting the company's overall strategic direction
variants.notes: Generic enough for most use cases when benefit is missing.
